attributes.action: Allow a petition starter to address parliament when a petition is to be debated
attributes.background: Currently a petition is debated upon its merits in a committee or house when it reaches it's 100,000 threshold. Democracy would be seen to be done if the petition  starter was part of the debate from the outset to represent all the signatories.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has a history of inviting even foreign dignitaries to address different areas of parliament. It is now time for petitions which reach 100,000 signatories to have their starting petitioner invited to parliament to address the start of the debate. If he/she would rather appoint a proxy then that too should be offered.

attributes.action: Investigate and amend laws on selling generic drugs as expensive brands.
attributes.background: Many pharmaceutical companies sell medications which are available as generics for extortionate prices. One example of this is Ibruprofen, which is still sold under different brands for many times the price.
attributes.additional_details: You can purchase Ibruprofen 200mg tablets x 16 at a supermarket for 0.16p. You can purchase Nurofen from the same supermarket, same dosage and quantity for in excess of Â£2.00. Nurofen is the same medicine as Ibruprofen but marketed under a different brand.

attributes.action: Deny visas to diplomats' spouses from countries that ignore Same Sex marriage.
attributes.background:
Many UK citizens have got married to non-Europeans/Brits under British same sex 'marriage'. 

When they return to these countries, the document and marriage is void- yet - it the same institution and certificate as a heterosexual marriage.
attributes.additional_details: Why should Ambassadors enjoy a freedom they deny others?

attributes.action: Make all cyclists and horse riders wear hi-vis clothing whilst on the roads
attributes.background: Make it the law that all cyclists and horse riders should wear hi-vis clothing whilst riding on the roads. A lot of cyclists and horse riders on the roads don't get seen until the last minute due to not wearing suitable clothing, especially during dusk and dawn.
attributes.additional_details: Having appropriate high visibility clothing would make it safer if for them and car drivers, especially if for whatever reason they ride at night without lights on.

attributes.action: Help people with UK pensions move their money to their home before they retire.
attributes.background: HMRC has delisted thousands of overseas schemes that could previously accept pension transfers from Britain. This is due to the Qualifying Recognised Overseas Pension Scheme. Which has recently been introduced. Many people started pensions in the UK knowing they would not be retiring in the UK.

attributes.action: Reform the Education System to Ensure Quality of Education for All
attributes.background: One third of all schools are failing the Ofsted reports, Schools simply cannot get enough teachers and students are reaching out to personal tutors more than ever. Teachers are unwilling to enter the system due to immense workload, pressure and stress. We petition the government to reform the system
attributes.additional_details:
We hereby petition the government to:

Scrap the Teaching Qualification in favour of on the job qualifications. The retired and unemployed with the required knowledge can enter and teach at all schools.

Reduce the red tape in teaching, let the teachers teach not administrate.

Students should not be spoon fed but taught to learn. It is not on the teacher if some are unwilling to work.

Teachers should be able to teach at their own pace.

British qualifications should compare internationally.

attributes.action: Stop all taxation
attributes.background: Stop taxes for every thing

attributes.action: Block all foreign trade with the USA
attributes.background: It's looking likely Donald Trump is going to win the Presidency.  We need to officially let the people of the USA know that if this happens UK will honour all existing trade but block all future deals, in effect putting them on the naughty step.  We cannot be part of this farce.

attributes.action: Tax Corporations at the point of delivery, not where corporations are registered
attributes.background: Many Larger and multi national Companies are able to move money and  profits in order to minimize Tax liability. where as domestic companies and individuals proportionally pay much more.
attributes.additional_details: As many large companies are able to move money and profits global in order to minimize  tax liability and are able to make up their own Tax policy regardless of State Tax Laws it is now necessary to Tax Companies and Charge VAT on the goods they sell at the point of Delivery therefor forcing them to pay the same tax rates as other domestic companies. If they were to do this then A. the Tax burden normal Tax payers would reduce and it would mean that all are treated equally under the Law

attributes.action: I want national insurance payments stoped after 28years
attributes.background: I worked from 1977 till now I think it unfair to pay national insurance after you payed the full amount to recive my pension it an unfair tax on hard working men

attributes.action: Cut income tax further
attributes.background: We need to cut income tax further for the lowest paid families but ALSO the best paid (top rate of tax). Simple economics: lower tax = more revenue for the state as it further promotes business.

attributes.action: Use ASBO's to help clean up chewing gum in public places.
attributes.background: Many people think that spitting out chewing gum, randomly discarding cigarette butts, fast-food wrappers, used tissue, sweet papers, etc., is acceptable behaviour.  Help change that.

attributes.action: Charities trustees only allowed on for 5 years max then must come off for 5 yrs
attributes.background: to stop nepotism and cronyism

attributes.action: No mandatory further education after Year 11
attributes.background: Teenagers are forced to go into further education. They should be able to make their own choices and go into a form of work if they wish.  There are lots of reasonable alternatives to further education. This could cause more people to become self employed and learn important life skills.

attributes.action: Introduce cap on what landlords can charge students for rent.
attributes.background: The government should be checking and making sure landlords aren't charging extortionate money to student tenants. Introducing a cap on rent for students in shared households and halls of residence means students wouldn't be struggling to make attempt to cover the missing finances.

attributes.action: Enforcing a stronger education to children about safety online through schools.
attributes.background: Educating children the basics on how to stay safe online is probably being done as we speak. However, the web is now scarier than ever as we all know. Bank details are being hacked, social media accounts, email's, photos, & text messages are no longer safe. So what is safe for our children?
attributes.additional_details: The idea of this campaign is to provide children with a better education of the web itself. This being manipulated in to giving personal details e.g: mobile numbers, home addresses, where they school, & photographs of themselves. Some believe children are easily drawn in by the internet and mystery of it all, I agree! So I think it's only fair we educate children on how to use the web safely, how to report situations they feel uncomfortable with, and to protect themselves.

attributes.action: Make fathers in prison who have jobs pay something towards child Surport
attributes.background:
Fathers who have committed crime and are serving prison sentences should be made to pay some controbution towards costs for there children
People on benifits pay a small amount of child Surport and prisoners should be made to pay something similar from there wages

attributes.action: The UK should buy a 12% stake in Airbus Group and push its listing on the LSE.
attributes.background: In October 2006 BAE sold its stake in Airbus to EADS. This marked the end of British ownership and a reduction of British influence in the civil airplane manufacturing industry. The UK was a founding nation in Airbus and should regain its place in civil aerospace next to France, Germany, & Spain.
attributes.additional_details: The government should also pursue this course of action because Airbus Group is a major defense contractor for the MOD. If Airbus group is to continue to be a main supplier to the MOD it should have equal loyalty to the UK as to Germany, France, and Spain. Finally, the UK government has low borrowing costs right now so the interest on the debt necessary to buy the stock may be easily covered by the dividends from the stock. Additionally the pound is currently strong relative to the Euro.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all betting shops to have bandit screens
attributes.background: In recent months there has been a torrent of staff being raped, held at knife point and zero security for the staff working in betting shops and nothing has been done about this. It's time companies that run betting shops are held accountable for the safety of the staff they employ!
attributes.additional_details: Since the release of the new regulations from the government for gambling more and more staff are being put at risk by their employers including a staff member who was raped in a store and more recently members of staff and the public being held at knife point is becoming more and more frequent. No measures have been put in place to protect the staff. One member of staff was held at gunpoint while a robbery took place. It needs to be addressed NOW before people die!!

attributes.action: IMMIGRATION: Facilitate sponsors to revoke the indefinite status online
attributes.background: Spouse/partner of sponsors oftentimes change attitude once they receive an indefinite status in the U.K. The spouse should be able to make an application online and request for the application to be revoked if the marriage was on false grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
The ILR revocation should be done via paying fees depending on either having evidence or no evidence. 
Applications with no evidence will require investigation, and cost higher as Home Office will have  the to check if the spouse is still living together or separately,  the visa then will be temporally revoked until investigation is complete. In certain situations Citizenship should be stripped too. The partner shouldn't be permitted to obtain 50% investment share through land registry either.

attributes.action: Raise maximum sentencing on those committing vile racism offences on citizens.
attributes.background: After recent events in the UK, a wave of hatred and racism has overshadowed the democracy to leave the EU. 100's of crimes of online and physical racism have been carried out particularly on EU citizens. With a new future for the country ahead, we need to stamp out this evil with increased severity.
attributes.additional_details: I can speak for the majority of people from both sides of the recent EU referendum who will condemn these vile attacks. Our country should be applauded and renowned for its diversity. Any form of racism against any citizen of any country residing in the UK should be deplored, and an increase in judicial sentencing on such crimes should be approved. Regardless of what world we live in, the UK should welcome all that arrive in this great democracy.

attributes.action: Bring back milk for primary school children
attributes.background: When I was younger we always had a small milk bottle with a straw. I think it's really important for children to get calcium and in this busy day and age ensures that all children get some milk.

attributes.action: We must have a 2nd EU Referendum: Vote restricted to those aged 16 to 50 years.
attributes.background: The result of the first referendum is essentially a tie.  The result of the first referendum is made null and void by the deliberate misinformation and lies of both the Leave and Remain campaigns.  The first referendum failed to recognise that the primary stakeholders are the young and not the old.
attributes.additional_details: The political elite and the political media have entirely failed the British people. The 2nd referendum should only take place once a mechanism has been devised to moderate the arguments put forward by the Remain and Leave campaigns.  At the very least, arguments would require references which support the argument, in a similar way to academic papers being considered for publication in a journal.

attributes.action: Parliament should vote to decide when we start negotiating to leave the EU
attributes.background: The UK must leave the EU through a well-ordered, timely negotiation. A rushed divorce will damage us both. Article 50.3 of the Lisbon Treaty gives us two years from notification before the Treaties expire. So we should not trigger Article 50 until Parliament votes to say we are ready to negotiate.
attributes.additional_details: The result of the referendum held on 23 June expressed the electorate's wish that the Government negotiate to Leave the EU. The events since make clear that neither the Government nor the Leave campaign have a plan for the UK's negotiation. So Parliament should exercise control over when the negotiation commences. A Parliamentary vote will also make it easier for the European Council to know when the UK has formally notified its intention to withdraw.

attributes.action: As law all convicted racists must integrate with whom they discriminate against
attributes.background: Instead of a slap on the wrist show them the people they are discriminating against, in a community service like format make them for example: go to mosque or church and go to community gatherings for an alotted ammount of hours

attributes.action: Mandatory and timely parliamentary debates for petitions with 100,000 signatures
attributes.background: Currently, petitions that reach 100,000 signatures do not require parliamentary debates. This is an inadequate and undemocratic response. Concerns expressed by large numbers of citizens, should invoke mandatory, timely parliamentary debates

attributes.action: To revoke the Barnett Formula for Scotland
attributes.background: Scotland has an unfair advantage due to the excessive money given to Scotland by the Barnett Formula. They use this to spend in uncontrolled ways, i.e. Free prescriptions and tuition fees.  This is grossly unfair to the people of England and should be stopped with immediate effect.

attributes.action: Re-Nationalise British Steel Industry following Brexit.
attributes.background: It appears unlikely a private buyer will be found following Brexit and we cannot afford to lose these skills, jobs or rely on overseas mills to supply our steel.

attributes.action: Add political history and international relations to the school curriculum.
attributes.background: A small number of people knew about how a democracy works at the end of the EU referendum. Even fewer understood what benefits the eu gave and the cost of having it. By adding how Britain creates and maintains relationships and political ideologies to the curriculum we should increase that number.
attributes.additional_details: I think evidence for the need for politics to be added is the large number of people asking for a second referendum because it didn't go their way. These people clearly do not know how a democracy works and they should. There also needs to be teaching into the benefits of international relations and the benefits each nation gives to the UK as well as how those relationships are formed and maintained.I propose they are added into PSHE lessons before the end of formal secondary education at 16.

attributes.action: Parliamentary inquiry into deceitful claims to sway an election or referendum
attributes.background: The Brexit campaign dishonestly pledged Â£350 million per week for the NHS in full knowledge that this was was an impossibility.  This is just one example of a growing trend in British politics.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a growing tendency for candidates to field statements that they know to be wrong merely to gain a vote for their party or themselves.  Integrity is being eroded together with the high standards that once reflected British politics and decisions.  Can a successful vote won on the basis of deceit be democratically or morally valid?
I believe that it is time to openly discuss this problem through the proper vehicle of a parliamentary enquiry into such practices.

attributes.action: Give free British citizenship to EU immigrants working in the UK over 5 years.
attributes.background: The U.K. is demonstrating a hostile feeling towards all immigrants.And now we are a population that feel openly ostracised,voiceless,discriminated against and unwelcome. We need clear evidence that we are wanted and welcome in this country and proof that we are an integral part of the U.K.'s future.
attributes.additional_details: The leaders of this country have a lot to answer to Immigrants for now.What's in it for us now that we are out of the EU and living in the UK? Besides xenophobia and ostracisation? What certainties are there for immigrants' future as members of this society and how are we clearly a part of the strategy for a United Kingdom that no longer abides by the laws and regulations of the EU. Giving us British citizenship will be the only true way immigrants will feel included and part of the U.K. again.
attributes.creator_name: Vasco SÃ©rgio Rodrigues Gaspar de Almeida Santos

attributes.action: Define rights of EU citizens currently living in Britain after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
There are many EU citizens who have been living and working in Britain for many years, and built lives here

Once Clause 50 is enacted, nothing will definite their status.
However, the British Parliament can define immediately what rights these people have once we are no longer in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Some EU citizens have lived here for decades, worked, paid taxes, and contributed to the British Economy.
No timeline has been given by Parliament to start, and it can take up to two years to complete
It is unfair to expect tax paying people to endure this period of uncertainty in their lives.  This decision does not need to wait for EU negotiations to begin, or await a new prime minister â it can be enacted with immediate effect, as this right will be the responsibility of the British People

attributes.action: Propose the EU a unified welfare system for unemployed  EU migrants.
attributes.background: European migrants, are attracted to Britain because of the generosity of its welfare system. If the EU shares common rights and laws for workers, then this should also include a common welfare system to stop the abuse of the welfare system and public resources in Britain.
attributes.additional_details: A unified welfare system would put a stop to the abuse of the British welfare system and public services from migrants, which is why so many people voted for BREXIT.

attributes.action: Appoint a youth representative to negotiations on exiting the European Union.
attributes.background: Acknowledging the evidence that 75% of young people (18-25) voted to remain in the EU referendum, we call on the government to include a youth representative in the negotiations on Britain's exit from the EU to speak for young people and their future in Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
The polls up to and following the referendum showed young people overwhelmingly in favour of Europe, one of the largest of these shows that 18-25 year olds clearly voted to remain: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/

Recognising that this affects the future of our country and our long term economic stability, we ask that young people get a voice in shaping this future.

attributes.action: Bring back capital punishment for peodophiles and child sex offenders
attributes.background: Make the future safer for kids.

attributes.action: Restrict petition signatories to 1 UK IP addresses ONLY to prevent further abuse
attributes.background: The petitions system is being blatantly abused by people who feel it is OK to use false data and sign a petition multiple times (and even write scripts to automate it), and that most critically non-eligible voters, outside of the UK are being allowed to steer our democratic process through fraud.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the expansion of social media, viral ideas are able to spread globally in minutes.  As we have seen in several recent petitions that have exploded overnight, that people on twitter, Facebook, 4chan, etc. are actively promoting petition fraud by having people sign using false UK addresses, and fraudulently declaring themselves to be eligible UK voters.  THIS MUST BE STOPPED.  It would be easily implemented (reduced) if Geographic IP filters are introduced, and IP addresses logged.

attributes.action: Create an independent cross-party & cross-industry task force to manage Brexit
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is such a big deal. There needs to be an independent body or committee tasked to re-negotiate a new deal that represents all UK citizens & UK businesses. This task force should have cross-party & industry-wide representation to ensure the re-negotiation with the EU is fair & balanced.

attributes.action: Require all health&beauty products to show if they are/aren't tested on animals.
attributes.background: Many household and health & beauty are tested on animals, but usually these products do not state that they are. This should be a requirement because animal testing is a horrid thing and many people are mislead to think they are buying cruelty free.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory for everyone over 16yrs and make sure its enforced.
attributes.background: I believe we should have a full and transparent view of our voting system, the voting for the EU referendum as a example why we should have a full view of every vote. 100% turn out and show a true scale of the votes so we dont have an issue with nearly half the country crying foul over non-voters
attributes.additional_details: EU Referendum - Massive outcry over voter turnout.

attributes.action: Make it law that a 2nd referendum cant be called for 20 years after the 1st.
attributes.background: To protect the democratic purpose of a refurendum a 2nd should not be held just because people disagree with the outcome. Having the law would mean people are fully aware of the consequences of voting in the first place. Its unfair for people to cast a vote then have to worry it could be overturned
attributes.additional_details: 2014 scottish independance from the UK referendum & 2016 UK membership of the EU referendum. These are two examples where calls for a 2nd referendum should be cancelled out by law, the decision has been made and should be respected.

attributes.action: Increase the HM Government Petition Response and Action Commitment
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to recognise the scale of opinion over lawful and reasonable public interest matters with the provision of additional petition signature number milestones.
attributes.additional_details: It is proposed that a parliamentary debate is held for petitions achieving 1 million signatures and positive change is instigated for petitions achieving 10 million signatures.

attributes.action: Negotiate with EU to allow UK/EU passports to give full EU passage until expired
attributes.background: UK passport holders need the right of passage within existing EU territories using our UK/EU passport in the same way as we use Pre Referendum

attributes.action: UK referendums to last a minimum of ten years, before repeating.
attributes.background: Scottish independence and EU referendum results to remain law for a minimum of ten years, along with any others which may follow.

attributes.action: Do not allow a second referendum on the EU to take place within the next 5 years
attributes.background: The nation has spoken and the result has been determined. Let's not change the rules after the fact.

attributes.action: Unite the country! An enquiry into the existing divide in the voting class
attributes.background: The UK on the 23rd June 2016 voted to leave the EU. The country had prior to, been subjected to scaremongering, distortion of facts and in general a politics filled with hate, divide and manipulation.
attributes.additional_details: In the aftermath of the vote, we awoke to a country on the verge on a breakup, with calls for a 2nd EU Referendum, a petition for the declaration of London's  independence and of course the call for a 2nd Scottish Referendum. We believe there is an urgent need for the UK Parliament to act and to prioritise the need to unite the country.We urge Parliament to examine the cause of the stark divide in society as reflected by the results of the EU Referendum by setting up a panel of enquiry.

attributes.action: Reduce sewage pollution on UK beaches - abolish OFWAT.
attributes.background: Every year millions of cubic meters of sewage laden waters end up in our rivers and on beaches. The current regulations are monitoring and reporting driven and fail to focus on proactive reduction of spills. OFWAT is a regulator that is obsessed with price reduction and fails to tackle this issue
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K. has a large number of beaches that are classified as having poor water quality and many others are inadequately monitored at all.
Sewage and hospital waste contained within are often found within shellfish and bathing water samples. All could be reduced through investment in storage capacity and real time control rather than the current monitoring.
We truly need to forget the political sensitivity of the price of water and allow price increases to permit investment

attributes.action: Give Bristol, Cambridge and other remain areas the chance to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Scotland and London have significantly voted to remain. As such actions are being taken to protect their democratic decision. 

Other parts of the UK have also strongly voted to remain and in any devolution options should have the option to join the parts of the UK that choose to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland are securing their right to have a 2nd referendum and London has a petition going strongly.

Certain areas and cities have overwhelmingly voted to remain in the EU, including Gibraltar, Northern Ireland, Manchester, Oxford, Brighton and more. These areas should not have their British identity stripped in devolution without choosing what their new identity will be.

attributes.action: Create an online voting system using NI numbers as identication to vote
attributes.background: I believe that a better voting system would involve using the Internet as a platform as more people would come forward to vote as it has easier access and by using the NI numbers everyone with have a unique number in which to cast their vote.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against homeless people a lawfully recognised hate crime
attributes.background: A hate crime is defined in British law as an act of violence or hostility directed at someone because of who they are yet homeless people are not covered by this law. We want new legislation to further prosecute people who commit hate crimes against homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: One year 52% of homeless people suffered from violence (Source: Crisis). Whilst this in itself is a criminal offence it is not further punishable under the Criminal Justice Act 2003. We would also like to have police support and advice to be more widely available for homeless people. Many homeless people are afraid to report incidents to police and we would like change this.

attributes.action: Introduce a Code of Conduct for all political advertising.
attributes.background: Since 1999 party political advertising has been outside any code of conduct and is unregulated. The content of some written and broadcast material from both sides in the recent referendum would breach the Advertising Standards Authority's code of practice if it applied to political parties.
attributes.additional_details:
To maintain freedom of expression we propose the code of conduct be applied to all written material and to broadcasts where there is no immediate ability to challenge a statement.

We petition that all statements made in both written and broadcast material meet the following criteria:
Statements implied as fact should be truthful, evidence based and responsible and not misleading or inflame or incite fear or hatred.   Statements that are based on opinion should be clearly indicated as such.
